title: overview
description: This project, developed as part of an Interaction Design Practice course, tackles a significant environmental issue: the low rate of electronic recycling in the United States. Our goal was to understand the public's perception of e-waste and design a digital solution to increase recycling literacy and effort.

title: challenge
description: Electronic recycling is a major challenge, with 70% of obsolete electronics staying in storage. Many states lack proper legislation for e-waste disposal, and the rapid pace of technology development creates a growing problem.

points.title: 1. accessibility gap
points.desc: 68% of survey respondents cited a lack of nearby recycling centers, and 52% found the process inconvenient.

points.title: 2. knowledge deficit
points.desc: 60% of participants were unclear on how to recycle electronics, and some were even unaware that it was an option.

title: solution
description: Our solution was a single application that integrates every step of the event management process, from booking and planning to payments. To develop this product, we followed a two-step process: research and analysis; ideation, design and testing.
